summary: This document is an email chain from May 2019 between a Southern District of New York (SDNY) Assistant U.S. Attorney and Isidro Garcia, with Mark Johnson copied. The emails discuss arranging a follow-up meeting with a female victim/witness in the SDNY's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The prosecutor requests the witness bring materials from the time she knew Epstein, including photos, phones, or gifts, to aid the investigation.

persons.name: Isidro Garcia
persons.role: Recipient of email, appears to be an intermediary for a witness
persons.context: Addressed in emails regarding scheduling a meeting and relaying requests to a witness in the SDNY Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Mark Johnson
persons.context: Listed in the Cc field of emails discussing the SDNY investigation meeting logistics.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the person whose conduct is under investigation by the SDNY; the witness knew him during a prior period.

connections.description: Garcia is an intermediary for a witness who knew Epstein, facilitating communication with SDNY prosecutors investigating Epstein.

events.title: Proposed SDNY investigation meeting
events.description: A meeting is proposed for May 29, 2019, between SDNY prosecutors/agents, a witness, and Isidro Garcia to discuss the witness's recollections of Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The SDNY was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein as of May 2019, following up on a prior investigation.
Prosecutors sought a meeting with a female witness to confirm her current recollections of Epstein's conduct, referencing her prior interview notes.
The witness was asked to bring physical materials from the time she knew Epstein, including photos, phones, and gifts, which the SDNY offered to copy or safeguard.
The correspondence shows prosecutorial sensitivity to not re-victimize the witness during the investigation.
